name: Albania
historySummary: In the last century, Albania has witnessed significant political and social transformations. From its communist regime, led by Enver Hoxha until his death in 1985, to its transition to a multi-party system in the early 1990s, the nation has experienced both challenges and growth. The fall of communism in 1990 led to economic collapse and social unrest, prompting an Albanian diaspora. The country faced significant turmoil in 1997 due to economic crisis. However, improvements in economic and political conditions throughout the early 21st century have allowed Albania to join NATO in 2009, and it is currently a candidate for EU membership.
joke: Why did the Albanian tomato turn red? Because it saw the salad dressing!

name: Andorra
historySummary: Andorra, nestled in the Pyrenees mountains, has maintained its status as a tax haven and a popular tourist destination. In 2008, it signed an agreement with the EU to improve its banking and financial practices, enhancing its global reputation as a financial hub.
joke: Why do banks in Andorra have a great sense of humor? Because they deal with a lot of 'cents'!

name: Austria
historySummary: Austria, with its rich cultural heritage and stunning Alpine landscapes, joined the European Union in 1995. It has played a key role in European politics and has been involved in various international peace initiatives. Austria is also known for its musical legacy, with famous composers like Mozart and Strauss hailing from the country.
joke: Did you hear about the Austrian musician who composed a symphony while drinking coffee? He really knew how to espresso himself!

name: Belarus
historySummary: Belarus has been ruled by President Alexander Lukashenko for several decades, leading to tensions with the EU over human rights and democracy issues.
joke: Why did the Belarusian computer go to therapy? It had too many control issues!

name: Belgium
historySummary: Belgium has faced political challenges due to linguistic and regional divisions. It's known for being the de facto capital of the European Union, hosting important EU institutions.
joke: Why do Belgians make terrible spies? Because they can't keep a secret in three languages!

name: Bosnia and Herzegovina
historySummary: Bosnia and Herzegovina experienced a brutal civil war in the 1990s. Since then, it has been working on post-war reconstruction and reconciliation efforts.

name: Bulgaria
historySummary: Bulgaria joined the European Union in 2007 and has since been working on economic reforms and improving its infrastructure.

name: Croatia
historySummary: Croatia became a member of the European Union in 2013. It has been focusing on tourism development and EU integration.

name: Cyprus
historySummary: Cyprus has been divided between the Greek Cypriot south and the Turkish Cypriot north since 1974. Reunification efforts have been ongoing, but a resolution has not been reached.
joke: Why did the computer go to Cyprus for vacation? Because it needed a byte of the Mediterranean!

name: Czech Republic
historySummary: The Czech Republic, formerly part of Czechoslovakia, became an independent nation in 1993. It has been an EU member since 2004 and is known for its rich history and culture.
joke: Why don't Czechs ever tell secrets? Because they always have a lot of 'Prague' on their minds!

name: Denmark
historySummary: Denmark has been a member of the European Union since 1973. It is known for its strong welfare system and commitment to renewable energy.
joke: Why do Danish farmers make great DJs? Because they're experts at mixing!

name: Estonia
historySummary: Estonia regained its independence from the Soviet Union in 1991. It has since developed a highly digitalized society and joined the European Union in 2004.

name: Finland
historySummary: Finland is known for its high-quality education system and has been a member of the European Union since 1995.

name: France
historySummary: Over the past 50 years, France has been under the Fifth Republic, a political regime that started in 1958 and is characterized by a strong presidential system. The country has seen significant demographic changes due to a post-war 'baby boom' and immigration, particularly from former French colonies such as Algeria, Morocco, Tunisia, Senegal, Mali, Cambodia, Laos, and Vietnam. This influx has contributed to debates on integration and national identity, especially concerning Muslim populations, as Islam is now the second largest religion in France.
joke: Why was the French football team so bad? Because every time they got a corner, they opened a cafe!

name: Germany
historySummary: Germany is one of the most influential countries in the European Union. It played a central role in the reunification of East and West Germany in 1990.

historySummary: Vatican City is the smallest independent state in the world, centered around the Vatican City. It is the spiritual and administrative center of the Roman Catholic Church.
